intro: Thevetia neriifolia var. leucantha, commonly known as the white-flowered yellow oleander, is a variant of the yellow oleander characterized by its pale yellow to white flowers. It is a shrub native to tropical and subtropical regions, featuring lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. The plant produces clusters of showy, fragrant flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. Its bark is smooth and grayish, and it has a woody stem structure typical of many members of the Apocynaceae family. Thevetia neriifolia var. leucantha is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in landscaping due to its resilience and adaptability.
